snippet: Former shareholders in the energy company had their award struck down, a victory for the Russian government, but they vowed to appeal.
abstract: Dutch court overturns award of more than $50 billion to former shareholders of defunct oil company Yukos; decision marks significant victory for Russia, which was ordered to make payments in 2014, but is unlikely to be end of dispute.

byline.contributor: Andrew E. Kramer contributed reporting from Moscow.

lead_paragraph: Former shareholders in the energy company had their award struck down, a victory for the Russian government, but they vowed to appeal.

headline.main: Dutch Court Overturns $50 Billion Ruling Against Russia in Yukos Case
headline.print_headline: Dutch Court Overturns $50 Billion Ruling Against Russia in Yukos Case
